channel.title: UK headlines
channel.description: Latest UK headlines on breaking UK stories from around Britain from Telegraph.co.uk
channel.copyright: ℗ & © 2014 of Telegraph Media Group Limited. Please refer to the Terms and Conditions of Use at http://www.telegraph.co.uk/rss

item.title: Spain's King Juan Carlos told Britain: 'we don't want Gibraltar back'
item.description: Spain's King Juan Carlos told Britain "We don't want Gibraltar back", declassified diplomatic documents from the 1980s reveal
item.author: Fiona Govan

item.title: Supervolcanoes caused by giant magma bubbles
item.description: Scientist have discovered that supervolcanoes are caused by the build up of giant magma bubbles.
item.author: Joe Kavanagh

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon: Scottish independence less risky than remaining part of UK
item.description: The Deputy First Minister woos Labour voters but faces accusations of having failed to answer basic questions over the pound and EU membership.
item.author: Simon Johnson

item.title: Lord Robertson: Scottish independence could lead to UK's disintegration
item.description: The former Nato Secretary general also warns separation could trigger the "re-Balkanisation" of Europe
item.author: Simon Johnson

item.title: Labour claims about energy 'overly simplistic, misleading' or 'just plain wrong' say experts
item.description: Big Six energy firms may have saved customers £500m rather than overcharging them by £4bn as Labour claimed, a respected energy consultancy suggests
item.author: Emily Gosden

item.title: Environment Secretary admits response to storm warnings was 'patchy'
item.description: Owen Paterson criticises reaction of some councils and power companies as another storm causes further flooding and disruption on the roads and railways
item.author: Sam Marsden

item.title: Moat victim officer bombarded his wife with 100 calls a day before taking his own life, inquest hears
item.description: Wife of policeman blinded by killer gunman Raoul Moat tells inquest her marriage was effectively over after her husband began new relationship
item.author: Martin Evans

item.title: Teenager collapsed and died in desert trek as he waited with inexperienced guide
item.description: A teenager collapsed and died on a school charity trek in 120F heat where he had to wait two hours to get medical help
item.author: Claire Carter

item.title: Power companies 'could deal better with bad weather', says Environment Secretary Owen Paterson
item.description: Environment Secretary Owen Paterson says the Government's "thoughts are with all those who have been affected" and "whose homes and businesses have been damaged" following the recent poor weather in Britain
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Nissan launches new London black cab
item.description: Nissan Executive vice president Andy Palmer launches the new version of the iconic London black cab
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Marine A: Sgt Alexander Blackman appeal bid after life sentence
item.description: Alexander Blackman has applied to appeal his conviction and sentence for murdering a badly wounded Taliban fighter
item.author: Ben Farmer

item.title: Singapore Airlines A380 makes emergency landing
item.description: A Singapore Airlines Airbus A380 "superjumbo" made an emergency landing in Azerbaijan on Monday, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded at the airport in the capital Baku.
item.author: AFP

item.title: Church of Scotland minister loses role as chaplain of Glasgow school after calling homosexuality a 'disorder'
item.description: Head teacher removes minister from post at Glasgow Gaelic School after Facebook comments
item.author: Auslan Cramb

item.title: Flooding: power firms 'could have done better'
item.description: Power network companies could have restored energy more quickly to thousands of homes affected by the floods over Christmas says Owen Paterson
item.author: Matthew Holehouse

item.title: Super Puma helicopter that crashed, killing all 16 on board, 'fell like a torpedo', inquiry hears
item.description: North Sea helicopter separated from its rotor blades before fatal accident off Peterhead
item.author: Auslan Cramb

item.title: Pictures of the day: 6 January 2014
item.description: Baby pandas, partying nuns and an erupting volcano.
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Barristers' strike: £1m wasted in court after legal aid protests
item.description: Almost £1m may have been wasted at crown courts as thousands of lawyers strike in protest against cuts to legal aid
item.author: Hayley Dixon

item.title: UK weather warning: as it happened
item.description: Coverage of today's strong winds and flooding affecting the UK, as the worst storms in two decades continue
item.author: Josh Warwick

item.title: Theatre assistant posted jokes on Twitter about patient's pubic hair
item.description: A theatre assistant has admitted posting comments on Twitter criticising colleagues and joking about a patient's pubic hair, as well as a photo of an ambulance arriving at A&E
item.author: Agencies

item.title: Sketch: George Osborne, prophet of gloom
item.description: The Chancellor gives a speech announcing the need for a further £12billion in cuts to welfare spending
item.author: Michael Deacon

item.title: Time travellers do not use Twitter, scientists find
item.description: An experiment to find out whether time travellers might give themselves away on social networks by referring to events which had not happened yet, has failed to find anyone from the future
item.author: Sarah Knapton

item.title: Ministers' red boxes chauffeured around in official cars
item.description: Ministers' red boxes are being ferried around in official government cars in hundreds of journeys a year, despite their owners taking public transport
item.author: Edward Malnick

item.title: UK weather in pictures: Heavy rain causes widespread flooding across Britain
item.description: Heavy rain causes widespread flooding across Britain.
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: The WaterAid H2Orchestra performs for Londoners
item.description: As the rain continues members of the WaterAid H2Orchestra embrace the wet weather by playing some of the UK's favourite pop songs from 2013 on hundreds of glasses of water
item.author: Ju Zhang

item.title: Motorist banned after driving with no hands
item.description: A 36-year-old man is banned from driving for 12 months after being caught on camera driving with no hands
item.author: Telegraph Staff
